        • pycheron.metrics.staltaMetric

    pycheron.metrics.staltaMetric¶

    staltaMetric(st, staSecs=3, ltaSecs=30, increment=1, algorithm='classic_LR', logger=None, processes=1, fortran=True, database=None)[source]¶

    Calculates the maximum STA/LTA for a stream of seismic data

    Parameters:
    • st (obspy.core.stream.Stream) – obspy stream object
    • staSecs (int) – length of short term averaging window in secs
    • ltaSecs (int) – length of long term averaging window in secs
    • increment (int) – increment (in secs) used when sliding the average windows to the next location
    • algorithm (str) – algorithm to be used. Currently supported algorithms include: “classic_RR”, “classic_LR”, “EarleAndShearer_envelope”
    • logger (pycheron.util.logger.Logger) – If using a logger, (you must create one using the util.logger class)
    • processes (int) – Number of processes to use for calculation (DEFAULT = 3)
    • fortran (bool) – Use Fortran libs or not. If libs will not compile or on a Windows Machine, set to False
    • database (pycheron.db.sqllite_db.Database) – database object
    Returns:

    list of dictionaries containing the following keys and types:

    • snclq (str)
    • start_time (str)
    • end_time (str)
    • max_stalta (float)
    • event_time (str)
    • metric_name (str)
    Return type:

    list

    Algorithm Notes

    This metric applies the STALTA method to every trace in the stream object using the following parameter settings:

    • demean = True
    • detrend = True
    • taper = 0.0

    The final metric value is the maximum STALTA value found in any trace in the stream object.

    Example

    # Initialize IRIS client
client = Client("IRIS")

# # Define start/end time and then get stream object
starttime = UTCDateTime("2012-12-12T00:00:00.000")
endtime = UTCDateTime("2012-12-13T00:00:00.000")
st = client.get_waveforms("AK","GHO","","BHN",starttime, endtime)

#Calculate the STA/LTA metric (use all default parameters) and show the results

stalta = staltaMetric(st)
print stalta
>>> [{'metric_name': 'staltaMetric', 'event_time': "2012-12-12T21:37:25.168400Z", 'start_time': "2012-12-12T00:00:00.008400Z" , 'snclq': u'AK.GHO..BHNM', 'max_stalta': 75.67122, 'end_time': "2012-12-12T23:59:59.988400Z"}]

    References

    [1]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_break_picking (Wikipedia)
    [2]http://www.crewes.org/ForOurSponsors/ConferenceAbstracts/2009/CSEG/Wong_CSEG_2009.pdf (Wong et. al. 2009)
    [3]http://www.fcaglp.unlp.edu.ar/~velis/papers/PickingGeop10.pdf (Sabbione and Velis 2010)
